tit.e: Issen Yoshoku (literally, one cent Western food)
Issen Yoshoku (literally, one cent Western food)
Issen Yoshoku (literally, one cent Western food)

sen.j: 一銭洋食（いっせんようしょく）は、水に溶いた小麦粉を鉄板で焼き、ネギなど乗せて焼いた物。
sen.e: Issen Yoshoku is wheat flour mixed with water and baked on a cast-iron pan, with green onion added onto it.
Issen Yoshoku is wheat flour mixed with water and baked on a cast-iron pan, with green onion added onto it.
Issen Yoshoku consists of a wheat flour mixed with water, baked on a cast-iron pan, with green onion added onto it.

sen.j: 関西風及び広島風お好み焼きの元になった料理である。
sen.e: It is a dish which has developed into Kansai-style and Hiroshima-style okonomiyaki (savory pancake with various ingredients).
It is a dish which has developed into Kansai-style and Hiroshima-style okonomiyaki (savory pancake with various ingredients).
It is a dish which has developed into Kansai-style and Hiroshima-style okonomiyaki (savory pancake with various ingredients).

sen.j: どんどん焼きが進化したもので、大正時代の近畿地方にて、水で溶いた小麦粉を焼いて、刻みネギなど乗せて焼いた物に、ソースをかけた物が出されていた物が一銭洋食として駄菓子屋などで売り出された。
sen.e: It was evolved from the Dondon-yaki (a Shinto blessing of objects that have been a part of a celebration but are now debris consumed by fire at the 14th to the 16th of the lunar New Year), and in Taisho Period wheat flour mixed with water and baked with chopped green onion and sauce added onto it was sold at mom-and-pop candy stores in the Kinki region.

It was evolved from the dondon-yaki (okonomiyaki wrapped around a wooden stick to take away), and in the Taisho period wheat flour mixed with water and baked with chopped green onion and sauce added onto it was sold at mom-and-pop candy stores in the Kinki region.
sen.cmt: in the Taisho period、dondon-yakiとし、dondon-yakiの補足が内容に沿わないため修正しました。(参照: http://www.jnto.org.sg/food.html)
sen.e: It was evolved from the dondon-yaki (okonomiyaki wrapped around a wooden stick to take away), and in the Taisho period wheat flour mixed with water and baked with chopped green onion and sauce added onto it was sold at mom-and-pop candy stores in the Kinki region.

sen.j: 当時はソース (調味料)さえかければなんでも洋食と見なされており、庶民の味として浸透し、お好み焼などへ進化していった。
sen.e: In those days anything with sauce (or seasoning) added onto it was regarded as Western food, and so it became widespread as commoners' dish, and developed into okonomiyaki.
In those days anything with sauce (or seasoning) added onto it was regarded as Western food, and so it became widespread as commoners' dish, and developed into okonomiyaki.
In those days anything with sauce (or seasoning) added onto it was regarded as Western food, and so it became widespread as commoners' dish, and developed into okonomiyaki.

sen.j: 戦後において一銭洋食は、「拾円焼き」「五〇円焼き」「キャベツ焼」などと銘打って店舗の軒下などで作られてきた。
sen.e: In the postwar period Issen Yoshoku was made under the eaves of stores in the name of "ju-yen (ten yen) yaki," "goju-yen (fifty yen) yaki" or "cabbage yaki."
In the postwar period Issen Yoshoku was made under the eaves of stores in the name of 'ju-yen (ten yen) yaki,' 'goju-yen (fifty yen) yaki' or 'cabbage yaki.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: In the postwar period Issen Yoshoku was made under the eaves of stores in the name of 'ju-yen (ten yen) yaki,' 'goju-yen (fifty yen) yaki' or 'cabbage yaki.'

sen.j: 具財はこんにゃく、もやし、魚粉、卵など多岐に渡り、店によって様々である。
sen.e: The ingredients varied greatly among stores, including konjac (gelatinous food made from devil's-tongue starch), bean sprouts, fish powder and egg.
The ingredients varied greatly among stores, including konjac (gelatinous food made from devil's-tongue starch), bean sprouts, fish powder and egg.
The ingredients varied greatly among stores, including konjac (gelatinous food made from devil's-tongue starch), bean sprouts, fish powder and egg.

sen.j: 因みに、お好み焼きと違い肉が使用される場合は主に牛肉になる。
sen.e: For comparison, unlike okonomiyaki, meat used in Issen Yoshoku was largely beef.
For comparison, unlike okonomiyaki, meat used in Issen Yoshoku was largely beef.
For comparison, unlike okonomiyaki, meat used in Issen Yoshoku was largely beef.

sen.j: 大阪府岸和田市のかしみん焼きや兵庫県神戸市長田区のにくてんの様に、一銭洋食系統の粉物料理が作られ続けている地域もある。
sen.e: In some areas flour dishes similar to Issen Yoshoku are still being made, such as kashiminyaki in Kishiwada City, Osaka Prefecture and nikuten in Nagata Ward, Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In some areas flour dishes similar to Issen Yoshoku are still being made, such as kashiminyaki in Kishiwada City, Osaka Prefecture and nikuten in Nagata Ward, Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture.
In some areas flour dishes similar to Issen Yoshoku are still being made, such as kashiminyaki in Kishiwada City, Osaka Prefecture and nikuten in Nagata Ward, Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture.

sen.j: ねぎ焼きはお好み焼店やまもとの店主が賄い用としてキャベツの代わりにネギを入れて作っていた物を商品化したものである。
sen.e: Negiyaki was commercialized by the owner of an okonomiyaki restaurant "Yamamoto," based on makanai ryori (meals which staffs of the restaurant cook for themselves) which the owner had prepared using green onion instead of cabbage.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Negiyaki was commercialized by the owner of an okonomiyaki restaurant "Yamamoto," based on makanai ryori (meals which staffs of the restaurant cook for themselves) which the owner had prepared using green onion instead of cabbage.

Negiyaki was commercialized by the owner of an okonomiyaki restaurant "Yamamoto," based on makanai ryori (meals which staffs of the restaurant cook for themselves) which the owner had prepared using green onion instead of cabbage.

sen.j: まぜ焼きであるお好み焼きから、粉が分離した一銭洋食スタイルへ回帰している。
sen.e: It returns from the okonomiyaki-style in which flour is mixed with other ingredients to the Issen Yoshoku style in which flour is separated from other ingredients.
It returns from the okonomiyaki-style in which flour is mixed with other ingredients to the Issen Yoshoku style in which flour is separated from other ingredients.
It returns from the okonomiyaki-style in which flour is mixed with other ingredients to the Issen Yoshoku style in which flour is separated from other ingredients.

sen.j: 手塚治虫の漫画「アドルフに告ぐ」では、一銭洋食ではなく、「一銭定食」という名で登場している。
sen.e: In "Adolf (comic)" by Osamu TEZUKA, a dish called "Issen Teishoku"(one-cent set meal), not Issen Yoshoku, appeared.
In 'Adolf (comic)' by Osamu TEZUKA, a dish called 'Issen Teishoku' (one-cent set meal), not Issen Yoshoku, appeared.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、スペース追加
sen.e: In 'Adolf (comic)' by Osamu TEZUKA, a dish called 'Issen Teishoku' (one-cent set meal), not Issen Yoshoku, appeared.

sen.j: また、「キャベツ焼き」（現在、関西圏で発売されている同名の料理とは別）とも呼ばれていた。
sen.e: It was also called "cabbage-yaki" (but it was not the same dish as the one currently sold in Kansai area).
It was also called 'cabbage-yaki' (but it was not the same dish as the one currently sold in the Kansai area).
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、in the Kansai areaとしました。
sen.e: It was also called 'cabbage-yaki' (but it was not the same dish as the one currently sold in the Kansai area).

sen.j: 京都市では、祇園（四条縄手上がる東側に）「壱銭焼き」として存在する。
sen.e: Issen Yoshoku exists in the name of "issen (one cent)-yaki" in Gion (on the east of Shijonawate Agaru), Kyoto City.
Issen Yoshoku exists in the name of 'issen (one cent)-yaki' in Gion (on the east of Shijonawate Agaru), Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: Issen Yoshoku exists in the name of 'issen (one cent)-yaki' in Gion (on the east of Shijonawate Agaru), Kyoto City.

sen.j: 高知県四万十市にも、「壱銭焼き」の店が存在するが、こちらは店名だけのようである。
sen.e: There is also a restaurant called "Issen-yaki" in Shimanto City, Kochi Prefecture, but it does not seem to serve anything like Issen Yoshoku.
There is also a restaurant called 'Issen-yaki' in Shimanto City, Kochi Prefecture, but it does not seem to serve anything like Issen Yoshoku.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: There is also a restaurant called 'Issen-yaki' in Shimanto City, Kochi Prefecture, but it does not seem to serve anything like Issen Yoshoku.
